amendment.description: Amendment sought to strike section 642, Termination of Monopoly Status, that permits users or providers of telecommunications services to renegotiate contracts or commitments with COMSAT.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, printed as amendment No. 7 in the Congressional Record of May 5, 1998 to delete the so-called "fresh look" contract review provisions in the bill that would allow companies under contract with COMSAT to renegotiate or terminate their contracts after 1999, without penalty.

action.text: On agreeing to the Tauzin amendment (A004) Failed by recorded vote: 80 - 339, 2 Present (Roll No. 128).
